docs.title: 🧠 Ahmed's Second Brain
docs.text: Welcome to my personal knowledge base. Here I document my Linux journey and coding studies. From system setups, new things I've learned recently, to notes from my courses and some tips and tricks useful for everyone. This is a work-in-progress (WIP) blog for my journey to become a Back-End Developer, so I may add, remove or edit things here as I progress on my journey.

docs.title: Click Here to Visit My GitHub Profile
Things I Do After Installing Fedora Workstation:
GNOME Tweaks to add maximize and minimize buttons to the apps window:
docs.text:
sudo dnf install gnome-tweaks

[!TIP] How to: open Gnome Tweaks, then go to Windows --> Titlebar Buttons, and switch on Maximize and Minimize.

docs.title: Adw-gtk3 to make GTK 3 apps consistent with GTK 4/ Libadwaita apps:
docs.text:
sudo dnf install adw-gtk3-theme

[!TIP] How to: open GNOME Tweaks, then go to Appearance --> Styles --> Legacy Applications , and select Adw-gtk3 or Adw-gtk3-dark from the menu.

docs.title: Brave Web Browser: Secure & Private by Design
docs.text:
1. Install the core plugins to enable the 'config-manager' command:
sudo dnf install dnf-plugins-core

[!INFO] What is config-manager? config-manager is a DNF plugin that simplifies adding, enabling, disabling, and removing repositories via command-line commands.

  1. Add the official Brave repository so that DNF can find the package:
sudo dnf config-manager addrepo --from-repofile=https://brave-browser-rpm-release.s3.brave.com/brave-browser.repo
  1. Install Brave Browser:
sudo dnf install brave-browser

[!QUESTION] Why add the Brave repository? Installing via the official repository ensures your browser updates automatically alongside your system updates, keeping your browser secure and up-to-date.

docs.title: Obsidian: The Best Note taking App
docs.text:
1. Ensure Flathub repository is enabled:
flatpak remote-add --if-not-exists flathub https://dl.flathub.org/repo/flathub.flatpakrepo
  1. Install Obsidian
flatpak install flathub md.obsidian.Obsidian

docs.title: Gnome Extension Manager: The Best Way to Browse, Install and Manage GNOME Shell Extensions
docs.text:
flatpak install com.mattjakeman.ExtensionManager

List of extensions I use:

  • AppIndicator and KStatusNotifierItem Support: Adds system tray icons support to the top panel.
  • GSConnect: To get notifications from my Android phone, share clipboard between my phone and my computer, and remote control my PC from my phone.
  • Clipboard Manager: Like its name says, a clipboard manager for GNOME (saves text you copy so you don't lose it).
  • Gtk4 Desktop Icons NG (DING): Allows me adding my files and apps to the desktop.
  • Tiling Assistant: Brings Windows 11 style Snap Assistant to GNOME.
